content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

```julia
using Threads

function pig_latinify(strings::Vector{String})::Vector{String}
    transformed_strings = Vector{String}(undef, length(strings))
    
    @threads for i = 1:length(strings)
        transformed_strings[i] = pig_latinify_string(strings[i])
    end
    
    return transformed_strings
end

function pig_latinify_string(string::String)::String
    words = split(string)
    transformed_words = Vector{String}(undef, length(words))
    
    for i = 1:length(words)
        transformed_words[i] = pig_latinify_word(words[i])
    end
    
    return join(transformed_words, " ")
end

function pig_latinify_word(word::AbstractString)::String
    vowels = ["a", "e", "i", "o", "u"]
    if startswith(word, vowels)
        return word * "way"
    else
        index = search(first, word, vowels)
        return word[index:end] * word[1:index-1] * "ay"
    end
end
```
